alert.note: Alert for Northern Herkimer; Southern Herkimer (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Lake Effect Snow Warning issued November 20 at 2:44PM EST until November 21 at 4:00AM EST by NWS Albany
info.description: ...LAKE EFFECT SNOW WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 AM EST MONDAY... * WHAT...Heavy lake effect snow. Additional snow accumulations of up to 5 inches, allowing for storm total amounts as high as 10 inches. The highest totals will be in areas close to Route 8. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph. * WHERE...Herkimer County. * WHEN...Until 4 AM EST Monday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult due to snow covered roadways. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches in southern Herkimer County. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snowfall rates may reach 1 to 2 inches per hour within the most intense portion of the snowband through this evening, mainly across central and southern Herkimer County. Experimental content below...do not use operationally. To view the experimental polygons please see: http://www.weather.gov/buf/lespolygon COORD...4333 7464 4339 7475 4343 7511 4323 7509 4309 7520 4296 7520 4297 7490 4303 7468 4302 7459 4318 7462 TIME Y22M11D20T1900Z-Y22M11D21T0900Z
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency.
